verses.kjv: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.
verses.ct: Jesus left that place and went to the region of Judea, crossing to the other side of the Jordan. Once again crowds gathered around him, and as he always did, he began teaching them.

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? tempting him.
verses.ct: Some Pharisees approached him and, trying to trap him, asked, "Is it permitted for a man to divorce his wife?"

verses.kjv: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?
verses.ct: He responded, "What did Moses command you?"

verses.kjv: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.
verses.ct: They replied, "Moses allowed a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "Moses wrote that rule for you because your hearts are so stubborn."

verses.kjv: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.
verses.ct: "But from the very start of creation, God made them male and female."

verses.kjv: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;
verses.ct: "This is why a man will leave his father and mother and be united with his wife,"

verses.kjv: And they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.
verses.ct: "and the 2 will become one flesh. So they are no longer 2 separate people, but one."

verses.kjv: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.
verses.ct: "Therefore, what God has joined together, no person should separate."

verses.kjv: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter.
verses.ct: Later, when they were back inside the house, his disciples brought up the same topic again.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.
verses.ct: He told them, "Whoever divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery against her."

verses.kjv: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.
verses.ct: "And if a woman divorces her husband and marries someone else, she commits adultery."

verses.kjv: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and his disciples rebuked those that brought them.
verses.ct: People were bringing little children to Jesus so he could touch them, but the disciples scolded those who brought them.

verses.kjv: But when Jesus saw it, he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
verses.ct: When Jesus saw this, he was upset and told them, "Let the little children come to me — don't stop them! The kingdom of God belongs to people like these."

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.
verses.ct: "I tell you the truth, anyone who doesn't receive the kingdom of God the way a child does will never enter it."

verses.kjv: And he took them up in his arms, put his hands upon them, and blessed them.
verses.ct: Then he picked the children up in his arms, placed his hands on them, and blessed them.

verses.kjv: And when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
verses.ct: As Jesus was heading out on the road, a man ran up to him, dropped to his knees, and asked, "Good Teacher, what must I do to receive eternal life?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God.
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone."

verses.kjv: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.
verses.ct: "You know the commandments: Don't commit adultery, don't murder, don't steal, don't give false testimony, don't cheat others, honor your father and mother."

verses.kjv: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.
verses.ct: The man answered, "Teacher, I've kept all of these since I was young."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go thy way, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, take up the cross, and follow me.
verses.ct: Jesus looked at him with love and said, "There's one thing you're missing. Go sell everything you own and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me, taking up the cross."

verses.kjv: And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.
verses.ct: The man's face fell at these words, and he walked away deeply saddened, because he owned a great deal of wealth.

verses.kjv: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.ct: Jesus looked around at his disciples and said, "How difficult it is for wealthy people to enter the kingdom of God!"

verses.kjv: And the disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.ct: The disciples were shocked by his words. But Jesus continued, "My children, how hard it is for those who put their trust in wealth to enter the kingdom of God!"

verses.kjv: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.ct: "It's easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?
verses.ct: They were completely stunned and said to each other, "Then who can possibly be saved?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.
verses.ct: Jesus looked at them and said, "For people, it's impossible — but not for God. Everything is possible for God."

verses.kjv: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.
verses.ct: Peter spoke up, "Look, we've given up everything to follow you."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel’s,
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "I tell you the truth, no one who has given up home, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or property for my sake and for the gospel"

verses.kjv: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.
verses.ct: "will fail to receive 100 times as much in this present life — homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and property, along with persecutions — and in the age to come, eternal life."

verses.kjv: But many that are first shall be last; and the last first.
verses.ct: "But many who are first will end up last, and many who are last will end up first."

verses.kjv: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,
verses.ct: They were on the road heading up to Jerusalem, with Jesus walking ahead of them. The disciples were amazed, and those following behind were afraid. He pulled the 12 aside again and started telling them what was about to happen to him.

verses.kjv: Saying, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:
verses.ct: "Listen, we're going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes. They will sentence him to death and turn him over to the Gentiles."

verses.kjv: And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.
verses.ct: "They will ridicule him, whip him, spit on him, and kill him. But on the 3rd day, he will rise again."

verses.kjv: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.
verses.ct: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him and said, "Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we ask."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?
verses.ct: He asked them, "What do you want me to do for you?"

verses.kjv: They said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.
verses.ct: They answered, "Let one of us sit at your right side and the other at your left when you come into your glory."

verses.kjv: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink of the cup that I drink of? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?
verses.ct: But Jesus told them, "You don't understand what you're asking. Can you drink the cup of suffering that I'm about to drink? Can you endure the baptism of suffering that I'm about to endure?"

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them, Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:
verses.ct: "We can," they replied. Jesus said to them, "You will indeed drink the cup I drink, and you will endure the baptism I endure."

verses.kjv: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.
verses.ct: "But sitting at my right or left side isn't mine to grant. Those places belong to the ones they've been prepared for."

verses.kjv: And when the ten heard it, they began to be much displeased with James and John.
verses.ct: When the other 10 disciples heard about this, they became very angry with James and John.

verses.kjv: But Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and their great ones exercise authority upon them.
verses.ct: So Jesus called them all together and said, "You know that those who are considered rulers over the Gentiles dominate them, and their high officials use their power to control them."

verses.kjv: But so shall it not be among you: but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your minister:
verses.ct: "But it must not be that way among you. Instead, whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant."

verses.kjv: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest, shall be servant of all.
verses.ct: "And whoever wants to be the most important among you must be the slave of everyone."

verses.kjv: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
verses.ct: "For even the Son of Man didn't come to be served, but to serve others, and to give his life as a ransom for many."

verses.kjv: And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the highway side begging.
verses.ct: They arrived at Jericho, and as Jesus was leaving the city with his disciples and a large crowd, a blind man named Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, was sitting alongside the road begging.

verses.kjv: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.ct: When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth passing by, he started shouting, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!"

verses.kjv: And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.ct: Many people told him to be quiet, but he shouted even louder, "Son of David, have mercy on me!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good comfort, rise; he calleth thee.
verses.ct: Jesus stopped and said, "Call him over." So they called to the blind man, saying, "Take courage! Get up — he's calling for you."

verses.kjv: And he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.
verses.ct: Bartimaeus threw off his cloak, jumped to his feet, and came to Jesus.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.
verses.ct: Jesus asked him, "What do you want me to do for you?" The blind man replied, "Lord, I want to see again."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole. And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.
verses.ct: Jesus told him, "Go — your faith has healed you." Instantly his sight was restored, and he followed Jesus along the road.
